intro: Centaurea janeri subsp. janeri, commonly known as the Janescent centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers. It is a perennial species that produces small, bracts-like leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
